problems.title: Vacuum Shuts Off / Hot
problems.description: Motor stops during use and won't turn back on immediately.
solution_steps: Wash the foam and felt filters located under the top cover.

problems.title: Floor Nozzle Hose Split
problems.description: You see a crack in the small hose connecting the head to the stick.
solution_steps: This hose is difficult to replace on its own.
Usually requires replacing the lower floor nozzle assembly.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a Rocket Corded Stick Vacuum (HV302)?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $455 vacuum, and extending the life of your Shark is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Rocket Corded Stick Vacuum (HV302) needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include strange noises and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my Rocket Corded Stick Vacuum (HV302) myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
